channel.title: still alive
channel.description:
Is this project still alive? I was shown this site by my son a very logn time ago and i was excited, I loved the mystery of Black Mesa and I liked the graphics (but not the locations/gameplay) of half life 2 so to have something that brought two of the things together was awesome.
But ive not really heard any more, has this project died a death or is it alive and kicking and is so... any ETA (i know that is a question we are not supposed to ask)

item.title: still alive
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
It’s all Biohazard’s fault and his innovation leading to feature creep.

Read full topic

item.title: still alive
item.dc:creator: sjp1966
item.description:
thanks for posting people, I must admit I have not visited here much lately as it seemed dead to me, only hope kept the bookmark in my favourites… from the screen shots i’ve seen it looks awesome.

Read full topic

item.title: still alive
item.dc:creator: BlackMesarulez98
item.description:
Captain Radical:

Grumpiest forum. But yeah, the question has been asked and answered in almost every forum for years. A little research before posting doesn’t hurt.

The dev team is still alive and kicking, the game is mostly done, just bug fixes and balancing issues. Supposedly they’ve been doing this for about a year, maybe more.

I agree. The mod is very much alive. There just “polishing it” and letting friends and family play test it before release.

Read full topic

item.title: still alive
item.dc:creator: Maxey
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Yep, this project is dead. It’s no use looking around the forums at all because there’s definitely no evidence anywhere that this mod is still alive.

Definitely. Directly creating a thread asking if the mod is dead without any previous research is by far the smartest thing anyone can do.

Read full topic
